bugs.title: deltarpm contains an own, modified copy of zlib

bugzilla.short_desc: deltarpm contains an own, modified copy of zlib

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
These packages in Fedora are with internals

Additional info:
1) #134 (Approval needed - zsync needs to ship internal zlib for rsync compatibility) - FESCo - Trac - https://fedorahosted.org/fesco/ticket/134
2)http://www.scrye.com/~kevin/fedora/fedora-meeting/2009/fedora-meeting.2009-06-04-16.33.log.html
Adding 'Tracking' keyword to be excluded from rawhide rebase to Fedora 11
Moving the "blocks" list to "depends on", tracker bug should depend on individual bugs, not block them.
As this one still seems to block for example 490140 (zsync), how could we proceed?

...for supporting the rsync protocol.

Shipping an own copy of a system library is not allowed by the Fedora Packaging Guidelines (and bad practise and bad for security). Problem is that rsync does also contain a modified version of zlib and though the modified zlib is needed to support the rsync protocol. This means that rsync/zlib needs to be fixed first.

See also: https://www.redhat.com/archives/fedora-devel-list/2009-September/msg00525.html and follow ups

According to Michael Schroeder, this is not the same fork as the rsync fork.  Does anyone know if this fork is necessary or just an optimization?  I'm rebuilding against system zlib now under the assumption that this is only an optimization.

mls, jdieter Okay, I've gotten all packages rebuilt but not pushed yet (except F-13 of course). mls, I'll attach the patch I made for your comments.  jdieter, can you do some testing?

To push this to F-12, we'll want to add information to this ticket about what we've tested:  https://fedorahosted.org/rel-eng/ticket/2240

We want to get this onto the releng boxes in fedora infrastructure as well.  But we'll need a change request for that.  I'd like to have testing done first so that we can make just one change request.

Here's the CVE for the zlib issue that's unpatched in the bundled library.
http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CAN-2005-1849

Created attachment 363280
Patch to build against system zlib and fix to detection of COMP_ZLIB_RSYNC payloads

Patch that's been applied or backported to deltarpm

I've just tested the builds for F11 and Rawhide (x86_64) from inside yum-presto (yum downgrade bzr; yum update bzr) and everything worked perfectly.

Thanks so much for your work on this!

comments.text: This update has been pushed to testing
This update has been submitted for stable
This update has been pushed to stable

notes:
deltarpm prior to the current build ships with a bundled copy of zlib.  This version of zlib has a known vulnerability with CVE identifier: CAN-2005-1849

This build of deltarpm patches the program to use the system zlib (which was fixed when the vulnerability was first discovered) instead of the bundled copy.
title: deltarpm-3.4-8.el5.1
